questions.question: At no time …………………………. her self control.
questions.description: When a negative word comes at the beginning we use an inverted word order.

questions.question: I hadn’t seen her ………………………….. years, but she wasn’t any different.
questions.description: We use for to indicate duration.

questions.question: This job is different from …………………………… I expected.
Today is …………………………… than yesterday.
questions.description: We cannot use very to modify comparative adjectives.

questions.question: I can’t tell you …………………………….. pleased I am about the result.
questions.description: We can use ‘how’ to express the idea of ‘how much’.

questions.question: Is this the first time you …………………………… here?
questions.description: We use the present perfect tense with ‘this is the first time’ etc.

questions.question: The car was damaged ……………………… a falling branch.
questions.description: In passive clauses we use by to introduce the agent.

questions.question: I have always ………………………… to play games well.
questions.description: We cannot use ‘can’ with have. Instead, we use be able to.

questions.question: I lost my job ………………………….. I was ill for six months.
questions.description: We use because to introduce the reason.

questions.question: If I had gone to university, I …………………………… law.
questions.description: In the third conditional, we use a past perfect tense in the if-clause and would have + past participle in the main clause.
